question: Who defeated Jake Paul in his first professional boxing loss via split decision?

content: Question: Who defeated Jake Paul in his first professional boxing loss via split decision?

<python>
# Search for Jake Paul boxing matches, focusing on his first professional loss
results = search_pages("Jake Paul boxing match first loss")[:5]

for result in results:
    page_id = result["page_id"]
    content = read_section(page_id + ":full")
    
    # Look for mentions of "split decision" or "first loss"
    if "split decision" in content.lower() or "first loss" in content.lower():
        print(f"=== {result['title']} ===")
        print(content)
        # Extract opponent name using regex
        import re
        opponent_match = re.search(r"(\w+ [\w\-]+)\s+defeated|fought|beat", content, re.IGNORECASE)
        if opponent_match:
            print(f"Opponent: {opponent_match.group(1)}")
        break

**Jake Joseph Paul** (born January 17, 1997) is an American social media personality and [boxer](professional)(professional boxer). He initially rose to fame on [Vine](Vine (service)), before playing the role of Dirk Mann on the [Channel](Disney)(Disney Channel) series *[Bizaardvark](Bizaardvark)* for two seasons. Throughout his career, Paul has become the subject of many controversies due to his behavior, including being charged with criminal trespass and [assembly](unlawful)(unlawful assembly).

Paul's boxing career began in August 2018 when he [defeated](KSI vs. Logan Paul) British YouTuber Deji Olatunji in an [contest](amateur)(Amateur boxing) via [TKO](technical knockout) in the fifth round. Turning professional, Paul beat the YouTuber AnEsonGib in January 2020, via TKO in the first round. Between 2020 and 2022, Paul won his following fights against retired basketballer [Robinson](Nate)(Nate Robinson) by second round [KO](Knockout) as well as retired [martial artists](mixed)(Mixed martial arts) [Askren](Ben)(Ben Askren), [Woodley](Tyron)(Tyron Woodley), and [Silva](Anderson)(Anderson Silva) by 1st-round TKO, twice by [SD](Split Decision) and 6th-round KO, and [UD](Unanimous decision), respectively. [Fury](Tommy)(Tommy Fury) handed him his first professional loss via [SD](Split decision).

In January 2023, he announced that he would be making his professional MMA debut with the [PFL](Professional Fighters League).
